rev.desc.rev.desc: log assignment change in start panel
Panel: go.stamp
changed the statements from
if (status in $L.file="Reopened") then (reopen.time in $L.file=$L.now)
if (status in $L.file="Reopened") then (reopened.by in $L.file=$L.operator)
to
if (status in $L.file="Reopened" and not same(status in $L.file, status in $L.old)) then (reopen.time in $L.file=$L.now)
if (status in $L.file="Reopened" and not same(status in $L.file, status in $L.old)) then (reopened.by in $L.file=$L.operator)
devtx I0730
added a message if duplicates are found.
devtx I0730

changed the exit on the call.sla panel from $normal to 'check.filename'. If the filename is not 'rootcausetask' then it means it is 'knownerror' so it follows new logic that takes the matching.ci structured array and checks for and removes duplicates.
ticket from devtx.
renamed rootcausetasks to rootcausetask on the go.stamp panel
Added call to SLA module.
make the 'Cancelled' status work the same way as the 'Closed' status
panel: go.stamp
updated expression setting 'open in $L.file' to include the "Cancelled" state
open in $L.file=status in $L.file~="Closed" and status in $L.file~="Cancelled"
Edited the go.stamp panel so that it uses:
if (filename($L.file)~="rootcausetasks") then (root.cause in $L.file=denull(root.cause in $L.file))
Instead of :
root.cause in $L.file=denull(root.cause in $L.file)
Nulled out closed.by and close.time when not closing a root cause or known error.
added a previous update time field
Changed all exits referencing $error to exit.error.msg except for the parameter panel and the exit.error.msg panel.
fixed really subtle bug where the RAD trigger stack was being reset by a nested trigger call
Use pmenv and environment in determing the status of the full.name condition.
scmsg
If the alert.time or deadline.alert fields have changed then pass those values to pm.process.alerts.
Before generating the alerts check the ticket status. If "closed" or "resolved" do not generate alerts.
nullsub problem.status to "Open" when stamping the record.
use same() operator to account for unknown full.name in $G.pm.global.environment.
Check if the reassignment threshold in the category record has been exceeded. If it has generate a reassignment alert.
If syshomesite = syscurrentsite then generate alerts.
Now calls setup.global routines.
moved the decision panel check of sysdistactive to the start position.
Put some performance enhancements in to minimize the number of physical reads associated with running this trigger > 1 time
If the problem ticket has no relevant SLA metric at this point in time, it will use the old style escalations
Will now invoke the SLA problem escalation code if the SLA module is enabled, and IF the ticket has an agreeement ID
Added a check of full.name in the environment record and stamp all *.by fields with the users full name if it is true.
moved the alert scheduler to this trigger from the post trigger and set the alert.time field in the problem record.

descript.descript: log assignment change in start panel
Panel: go.stamp
changed the statements from
if (status in $L.file="Reopened") then (reopen.time in $L.file=$L.now)
if (status in $L.file="Reopened") then (reopened.by in $L.file=$L.operator)
to
if (status in $L.file="Reopened" and not same(status in $L.file, status in $L.old)) then (reopen.time in $L.file=$L.now)
if (status in $L.file="Reopened" and not same(status in $L.file, status in $L.old)) then (reopened.by in $L.file=$L.operator)
devtx I0730
added a message if duplicates are found.
devtx I0730

changed the exit on the call.sla panel from $normal to 'check.filename'. If the filename is not 'rootcausetask' then it means it is 'knownerror' so it follows new logic that takes the matching.ci structured array and checks for and removes duplicates.
ticket from devtx.
renamed rootcausetasks to rootcausetask on the go.stamp panel
Added call to SLA module.
make the 'Cancelled' status work the same way as the 'Closed' status
panel: go.stamp
updated expression setting 'open in $L.file' to include the "Cancelled" state
open in $L.file=status in $L.file~="Closed" and status in $L.file~="Cancelled"
Edited the go.stamp panel so that it uses:
if (filename($L.file)~="rootcausetasks") then (root.cause in $L.file=denull(root.cause in $L.file))
Instead of :
root.cause in $L.file=denull(root.cause in $L.file)
Nulled out closed.by and close.time when not closing a root cause or known error.
added a previous update time field
Changed all exits referencing $error to exit.error.msg except for the parameter panel and the exit.error.msg panel.
fixed really subtle bug where the RAD trigger stack was being reset by a nested trigger call
Use pmenv and environment in determing the status of the full.name condition.
scmsg
If the alert.time or deadline.alert fields have changed then pass those values to pm.process.alerts.
Before generating the alerts check the ticket status. If "closed" or "resolved" do not generate alerts.
nullsub problem.status to "Open" when stamping the record.
use same() operator to account for unknown full.name in $G.pm.global.environment.
Check if the reassignment threshold in the category record has been exceeded. If it has generate a reassignment alert.
If syshomesite = syscurrentsite then generate alerts.
Now calls setup.global routines.
moved the decision panel check of sysdistactive to the start position.
Put some performance enhancements in to minimize the number of physical reads associated with running this trigger > 1 time
If the problem ticket has no relevant SLA metric at this point in time, it will use the old style escalations
Will now invoke the SLA problem escalation code if the SLA module is enabled, and IF the ticket has an agreeement ID
Added a check of full.name in the environment record and stamp all *.by fields with the users full name if it is true.
moved the alert scheduler to this trigger from the post trigger and set the alert.time field in the problem record.
